ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about the ways that AI and innovation are changing economics.

I definitely learned a lot about AI and the market that it is creating for itself. I also learned about about the different types of microeconomic games we can play with in this field - we also worked through a lot of the math.

I learned the theory behind the implications of AI in our society. I learned how AI may influence bundling, searching costs, price discrimination, patents, copyrights, and more. I learned to embrace the changes AI brings and to understand how they will shift the world we live in. I learned to build models to understand these changes.
I learned new economic models that applied to spaces that companies that use AI occupy. I learned new ways AI is being applied to many industries.
I gained knowledge of cutting-edge companies and technology implementing artificial intelligence, and I gained skills of presenting an industry analysis and writing a memorandum.

Gained a greater understanding of some of the mathematical models by which firms make decisions for things like durable goods and price discrimination. Also gained some understanding of how technology has made its way into a variety of industries.
I learned about how technology is affecting the economics of businesses.
This was a great course that strengthened my microeconomics skills.
This class taught me what is going on in the start-up and venture capital world. I also learned and refined some interesting economic models and games.
A lot of in depth analysis surrounding microeconomic theory and how it relates to todays rapidly changing world

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed everything about this class. I do not see any cons. Eva is legendary and such a wonderful and kind person and professor.

I felt like this class was well-organized and well planned out. Professor Chalioti did a great job ensuring that the material we saw in our problems sets were concepts and ideas we had reviewed in class. She went out of her way to make sure the material was relevant, engaging, and interesting.

The strengths are the breadth of topics covered and how each of them relate to new technologies being developed in our world. The weakness was that sometimes the link to AI was lost and the practical applications did not always come through in the models.
Strengths: expectations from the student are clear! the class is extremely fair with no surprises. the topic is also incredibly fascinating

Strengths: Prof Chalioti is fantastics--she is clear, knowledgeable, and helpful.
Weaknesses: The course, as it is promoted as, does not teach the methods of AI or discuss the technical aspects of AI or machine learning.
Strengths include extremely interesting course material and lecture content and an engaging presentation project and memorandum. Professor Chalioti is very knowledgeable about the course topic.
I thought that the class was perfectly taught. It could be slightly improved by laying out due dates well in advance.

Strengths: Lectures are easy to follow with the content being interesting and relevant. The assignments, especially the industry report + presentation, were fun to do. The material is a good blend of micro (models, simple calculus) and current affairs (lots of industry analysis and study of business models). Most importantly, Professor Chalioti is the best - she genuinely cares about her students and always makes herself approachable and available. 
Weakness: The presentations eat up a lot of class time that could be used for new material.
No weaknesses. This was a great course!
Professor Chalioti's enthusiasm made this a great class. Her focus on new tech in our world kept things interesting and engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would 100% recommend this class. Eva is legendary, and is always willing to help out. She is super fair with her grading and her assignments are made to help you learn rather than just do busy work. If you can get a spot in this class, you should take it.

This is a great Senior Economics seminar and I would highly recommend taking it! You learn a lot of material that is directly related to economics, but you also zoom out a bit to discuss AI in general and how it is used in other industries, which was a great way to introduce students' voices into the classroom. The course is well-structured, interesting, and has a reasonable workload.
Take this class, it's the best Econ senior seminar out there!!

I would certainly recommend this course to someone who is looking for an introduction to how AI may influence the world and models we know today. The course explores several different topics and industries that we all interact with, so seeing how AI influences them and changes their models is incredibly rewarding.
Yes yes yes, it's a great option for a senior Econ seminar
Yes. I took this course having only taken introductory Econ courses and found it manageable, so I would encourage students who are not Econ majors but are interested in AI to take the course.

Yes, ECON 472 is a fantastic course! I highly recommend the class to anyone who is interested in learning about cutting-edge technology, discussing companies implementing AI, and presenting an industry analysis. The knowledge and skills I learned in ECON 472 will be beneficial in my future career in finance.
I would highly recommend the course. It is a very accessible way to get an introduction into how technology makes its way into a variety of industries and how it may shape the future.
I would highly recommend this class to other students. It is a great senior seminar for those interested in technology.
Yes!
Yes! One of the best econ classes.
Absolutely! Prof. Chalioti was an excellent professor and always was prepared with interesting material.
